idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350

descript.abstract: United States Census Block Centroid Populations is a point theme representing the populations of the U.S. Census blocks for United States. U.S. Census blocks are the smallest geographic entities within a county for which the Census Bureau tabulates population.
descript.purpose: United States Census Block Centroid Populations provides population and other demographic information for each U.S. Census block centroid within United States.
descript.supplinf:
Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:100,000.
This dataset comes with an ESRI layer file representing the number of households.

citeinfo.title: United States Census Block Centroid Populations, 2010

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States: Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

enttyp.enttypd: The points represent the centroids of census blocks, the smallest entity for which the Census Bureau collects and tabulates decennial census information within United States; bounded on all sides by visible features such as streets, streams, and railroad tracks, and by invisible boundaries such as city, town, and county limits.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (two-digit number) for the state in which the block is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (three-digit number) for the county in which the block is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The combined state and county FIPS code. County FIPS codes begin with 001 for each state, use the combined code (five-digit number) to uniquely identify a county.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The four-digit number, with a two-digit suffix, used to identify a census tract. Census tract numbers are always unique within a county and usually unique within a metropolitan area.

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The Census code (four-digit number) for the block.

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The combined state and county FIPS codes, and tract and block Census codes.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology and Census Bureau

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The total number of households in the block in 2000.
The total number of housing units in the block in 2000.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI® software.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States, contact the ESRI Telebusiness staff at 800-447-9778 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html.

citeinfo.title: ESRI Business Analyst Desktop 9.2 2007 Update - U.S. Block Centroids, 2010

srcinfo.srccitea: ESRI Business Analyst Desktop 9.2 2007 Update U.S. Block Centroids

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Copied ESRI Business Analyst Desktop 9.2 2007 Update U.S. Block Centroids. Added attributes STATE_FIPS, CNTY_FIPS, STCOFIPS, TRACT, and BLOCK and created their values from parsing the values of the FIPS attribute. Removed unneeded attributes. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was calculated from latitude/longitude coordinates. The horizontal positional accuracy is unknown.

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either tools in ArcGIS or ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2). The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
